We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programs that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group's global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! PMG Management Office ("PMO") is the Operating Centre of Excellence for Product Management Group across all offerings, all teams and all locations. The team is responsible for strategic initiatives, data management, new products, change and transformation including Advisory & Execution, operational risk and business management. The Content-Led Wealth Management tribe (CLWM) defines and delivers advanced discretionary and advisory initiatives, bringing great value to Clients and to our Front Office teams. We are part of the Product team (PMG) and work in close partnership with business stakeholders and the technology teams. We are starting an ambitious project to launch Blackrock Aladdin to support the growth of the Discretionary and Advisory Portfolio Management offerings of BOS (DPM and APM). This initiative will provide greater portfolio management capabilities with improved risk measurement, higher automation and operational efficiency. Reporting to the Aladdin Business Project Manager, t he role will support the on-boarding, implementation and successful roll-out of the Aladdin solution This is a persistent role which goes beyond the initial roll-out, as the solution will evolve to support the growth of APM/DPM. The role holder will work with various system and process owners that contribute to or are part of the overall area. Responsibilities The Area Product Owner's main responsibilities will be to support and work hand in hand with the Project Manager for the following activities: Definition of an agreed Target Operating Model for APM and DPM offerings supported by Aladdin. Definition of the project plan together with IT counterparts. Partner with Technology stakeholders and external vendors to ensure alignment through the different project phases. Ensure adherence to timeline, budget, features. Ensure timely communication, including preparation of Monthly Project Committees Drive UAT (incl. coverage and successful execution) and training, to e nsure quality of the delivery and the successful adoption of the new solution Successful roll-out of Aladdin, with a high-quality standard and high user adoption. Qualifications Requirements 10 years of experience in managing projects end-to-end, from Inception to roll-out & training. Proven experience in leading transformational projects in wealth & asset management or portfolio management business. Deep expertise in advisory and portfolio management businesses in wealth management In depth knowledge of Blackrock Aladdin Experience with Aladdin implementation projects. Knowledge of Temenos Triple A Plus an advantage Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and to adapt to complex demands in a diverse culture Strong stakeholder management skills and good interpersonal skills, the candidate will demonstrate ability to work confidently and collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders of varying seniority. Degree, master's degree in computer science, Technology, Finance

Job_Title: CGO – Strategic Pursuits Team - Deal Execution Leader (DEL)
Job_Descriptions: CGO – Strategic Pursuits Team - Deal Execution Leader (DEL) Role Purpose: This roles exists to support the shaping, selling and closing of strategic deals (Min TCV $50mUSD/ new and targeted offerings, new markets/ targeted e APMEAclients) across th geography. Role Description: The role reports to the Strategic Pursuits Sales Leader for APMEA and works in collaboration with the CTO / Lead solution architect role. The core purpose of this role is the ensure all deals accepted into the Strategic Pursuit team pipeline are solutioned, priced and positioned as winning deals, by working hand in hand with the clients, the strategic pursuits team and the nominated SPOCs from internal Wipro organisations (SMU, GBL, CGO) to optimise our competitiveness and success. Deal Shaping – working with the Sales Leader and the nominated Lead Solution Architect to ‘create’ the initial pitch to the CXO levels in targeted clients. The DEL will engage with the GBL’s, Domain consulting and WIPRO’s SME’s to enhance & enrich the pitch & ensure we can deliver. This role will work closely with respective regional Pre-sales and play a key role in strategy workshops, qualification discussions and competitive analysis. The Bid Management and Presales team will work on the direction provided by this role to ensure relevance of the content, the pitch and the key messaging for such pursuits. Pursuit Process – the DEL will lead the workshopping process between the client and WIPRO where needed. Building the agenda and enrolling the essential delegates to ensure an engaging and compelling experience. 1.Collaboration workshops – set-up and lead / co-facilitate with the Sales Leader / Lead Architect 2.Client engagement -  work closely with the Sales Lead to broaden our coverage across the client, bringing in GBL & Consulting SME’s and connecting with Global centres of excellence to bring the best of WIPRO to the pursuit. 3.Accountable for Qtrace and data for deal updates to SMU leaders and CGO, in conjunction with the Sales Leader Solution & Pricing – the DEL will lead the WIPRO solutioning and pricing teams working on any of the Strategic Pursuit teams deals. Providing guidance and leadership to the practices groups involved in building the solution & regular liaison with the pricing function to ensure we’re working on a ‘price to win’. In essence, the DEL will be the conduit with the client’s team to drive a co-creation Proposals & Presentations- working closely with the Sale Leader and the account / deal team, the DEL has overall responsibility for the production of high quality, compelling and differentiated WIPRO proposals and lead oral presentations. This role ensures the right support team is enrolled to bring the best in thought leadership, design and communication to our clients and new logos. Role Description: Negotiation, Contracting and Closing – The DEL will lead the framing of the negotiations, applying best practice principles and methods to build a clear and disciplined negotiation plan for all strategic deals. Working hand-in-hand with the clients nominated delegates to build a principled and professional negotiation pathway. Engaging the appropriate WIPRO resources for all contracting & legal inputs. Engaging WIPRO signing executives early in the process to ensure a smooth and approved process & contract agreement Working closely with the sales lead and SMU leadership to set-up and execute negotiations, contracting and signing meetings Reward & Recognition: The role is banded as D1/D2 with scope for a executive level base remuneration The Bonus program for this role sits within the Strategic Pursuit incentive program (copy of this program available upon request) – there is a generous bonus pool available for nominated deal team members for strategic deal wins. Reporting line: This role will be part of the Global Growth Office, reporting to the APMEA Sales Leader – Strategic Pursuits and part of the global pursuits team, led by Eddie Woods.

Nombre del sítio: Singapore - Tuas Fecha de publicación: Jan 27 2022 Our Tuas site, one of only two GSK global vaccines manufacturing facilities worldwide, operates around-the-clock to manufacture the active ingredient used to make a GSK vaccine that protects children against pneumonia. As a Biotechnologist/ Senior Biotechnologist in our Value Stream, you will participate in the preparation, operation and completion of assigned process stages to ensure the production of bulk drug substances is within establish timing and quality standards. You will also ensure good housekeeping of the facilities to keep them in good operational order in line with cGMP, safety and environmental requirements. Key Responsibilities: Operations Adhere to cGMP and safety requirements Ensure good housekeeping of associated production facilities so that they are kept in good operational order Identify areas for improvement and participate in continuous improvement projects to enhance operational effectiveness and efficiency Participate in commissioning and qualification activities as required Carry out other related duties as assigned by the N+1 Assigned as in-charge by process/operations area to provide guidance/leadership to ensure processes are completed reliably Planning Follow the day-to-day planning Assist Lead Biotechnologist or Shift Supervisor or Operations Superintendent in detailed team operations planning Training & Development Ensure that he/she is trained/qualified in the current effective SOP and OJT in accordance with the assigned training curricula prior to commencing operation. Proactively engage N+1 to discuss personal development and follow up on agreed development plan. To provide guidance and support to new joiner ensuring his/her smooth transition to the new environment To develop oneself as a process SME Guide junior employees to ensure knowledge transfer for business continuity. Conduct classroom and on-the-job (OJT) training as assigned. Quality Comply with all relevant SOP/Batch record requirements. Perform timely review of documentation and make necessary corrections. Have good quality mindset and integrity to ensure products are manufactured with the highest quality Participate in deviation investigation process (Process, Environmental, Maintenance/Equipment, QC) and implementation of Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) Participate in cGMP self-inspections to ensure compliance with internal SOPs and regulatory requirements Reporting/Documentation Operate key computer applications related to production function Ensure that batch record, checklist and logbooks are correctly recorded, cGMP complied and maintained Maintain clear communication with N+1 and fellow colleagues, providing clear feedback of any items pertaining to safety, quality and efficiency Participation in development and generation of production checklist, SOPs, validation protocols and the regular review and updates of these documents Perform VS review of completed documentation to ensure adherence to GDP To lead design/drafting of working instruction to ensure that it is user friendly to improve GDP Technology Transfer Participate in new technology and/or new process transfer Security/Safety/Environment Awareness and adherence to site safety procedure. Ensure safe operations on the field Identify and report all potential safety issues (personal protection requirement, equipment protection, way of working etc). Ensure proper housekeeping of assigned production areas to minimize safety hazards Participate in Safety Inspections Participate in Workplace Risk Assessment Interface with other Department/Team Coordination with department colleagues to ensure Timely supplies of materials and buffers Calibration/maintenance activities are supported. Open communication on sampling requirements to QC department Establish good working relationship with QA, QC, maintenance, calibration to ensure smooth operations. Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Must have NITEC/HIGHER NITEC/DIPLOMA in Biotechnology/Chemical Engineering/Life Science Has relevant experience in Biologics/Chemical/Pharmaceutical/ Food or other regulated industry is preferred Basic knowledge of cGMP Familiar with Purification and Coupling Process (e.g. Chromatography, Ultrafiltration, Filtration and titration) A good team player and able to work independently Good communication and documentation skills Has disciplined and quality mindset Why GSK? At GSK, we have already delivered unprecedented change over the past four years, improving R&D, becoming a leader in Consumer Healthcare, strengthening our leadership, and transforming our commercial execution. Now, we’re making the most significant changes we’ve made to our business in over 20 years. We’re on track to separate and create two new companies in 2022: New GSK with a leading portfolio of vaccines and specialty medicines as well as R&D based on immune system and genetics science; and a new world-leading consumer healthcare company of loved and trusted brands. With new ambition comes new purpose. For New GSK, this is to unite science, talent, and technology to get ahead of disease together – all with the clear ambition of delivering human health impact; stronger and more sustainable shareholder returns; and as a new GSK where outstanding people thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it. How we do all this is through our people and our culture. A culture that is ambitious for patients – so we deliver what matters better and faster; accountable for impact – with clear ownership of goals and support to succeed; and where we do the right thing . So, if you’re ready to improve the lives of billions, join us at this exciting moment in our journey. Join our challenge to get Ahead Together. *This is a job description to aide in the job posting, but does not include all job evaluation details. Nuestro objetivo es ser una de las empresas de atención médica más innovadoras, de mejor desempeño y más confiables del mundo. Creemos que todos aportamos algo único a GSK y cuando combinamos nuestros conocimientos, experiencias y estilos, el impacto es increíble. Únase a nuestra aventura en GSK donde se inspirará para hacer el mejor trabajo para nuestros pacientes y clientes. Un lugar donde puede ser usted mismo, sentirse bien y seguir creciendo. About Essence Essence, part of GroupM, is a global data and measurement-driven media agency whose mission is to make advertising more valuable to the world. Clients include Google, T-Mobile, Target, Flipkart, NBCUniversal, L'Oreal and the Financial Times. The agency is more than 2,000 people strong, manages $4B in annualized media spend and deploys campaigns in 106 markets via 20 offices in APAC, EMEA and North America. Visit essenceglobal.com for more information and follow us on Twitter at @essenceglobal About the Role: Essence is seeking a smart, enthusiastic indiviudal to become an integral part of our Advertising Operations team. Our team is  responsible for ad serving, campaign tracking, asset management, web/app analytics, and other optimisation technologies associated with the execution of digital advertising – and for ensuring digital campaigns are launched on time and run accurately. We provide consultancy to our clients and colleagues and are at the centre of all things tech within the agency. Our team is structured to provide a tailored approach that is both flexible and adaptable to align to our clients needs. As a Senior Advertising Operations Executive within our team, you will be responsible for the set-up, execution and delivery of digital campaigns via a 3rd party ad serving platform. You will work with both internal teams (Client Services, Media Analysts, Media Buying and Planning) and external parties (Publishers) to ensure campaign delivery objectives are met. Some of the things we’d like you to do: Manage the set up campaigns, placements and creative assets through the use of 3rd party ad serving platforms and vendor interfaces. Maintain regular checks and analysis of campaigns to ensure 100% accuracy. Work with external vendors and publishers to resolve issues quickly including creative, tag and reporting. Attend interdepartmental meetings and provide advice on Ad Operation best practice, campaign optimisation, reporting and tracking requirements. Monitor reporting on a daily basis to ensure campaigns are running as expected, providing optimization recommendations and escalating to third parties when appropriate. Present in internal team meetings and participate in client meetings on an ad hoc basis. Support team leadership in the continual assessment of ad tech platforms and tools; and provide support in testing of different products, including client recommendations, implementations and consulting Support client deliverables and projects on an ad-hoc basis. Act as an ambassador of ad operations across the agency. Train new starters and continually educate teams on recent developments; building advocacy across the agency. A bit about you: 2+ years’ experience in ad operations advertising operations with demonstrable knowledge of ad serving, preferably gained agency side Diligent and attentive to detail; able to follow through on projects and/or issues independently Confidence in making information based decisions An active interest in everything digital, ideally with an understanding of online advertising industry trends A self-starter with the ability to manage your own workload. Able to multitask, prioritise and manage expectations. Some experience working with DoubleClick, Sizmek, AdForm, Flashtalking and other 3rd party ad servers Knowledge of web technologies including HTML, JavaScript or PHP would be a bonus Knowledge on DSPs, DMPs, Tag Management Systems, Ad Verification or Site Analytics tools would be a bonus Computer literate with good skills in all basic Office programmes (including Excel) Excellent verbal & written communication skills What you can expect from Essence: This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing, dynamic agency which is doing cutting edge-work for key clients in the digital industry. You will get the opportunity to take on additional responsibilities and to build on your skills and experience all within a fun and rewarding working environment!

About GlobalFoundries GlobalFoundries is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GlobalFoundries makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets.  For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com Project Title Internship in Wafer Fabrication Process Engineering Project Objective / Purpose (Introduction) Wafer fabrication is the fundamental of all electronics and its applications in the semiconductor supply chain. Everything starts off with a bare silicon substrate, which undergoes many processing steps to form the ultimate IC chips that power up the electronics appliances. Controls are put in place to monitor the critical processing steps to detect any abnormalities early and to guarantee the wafer quality upon completion. Project Description Students will be attached to a Module and get to learn: 1. Overview of the wafer fabrication process 2. Purpose/function of this process module 3. Front-end and Back-end processes 4. Materials used in this process 5. Controls used in this process - the parameters monitored - the Statistical Process Control (SPC) system 6. What is a SPC chart and setting of control limits in SPC to detect any process drifts. 7. Recipes used in the process - How to validate a recipe vs a golden recipe 8. Shadowing mentor to assist the works inside the Fab 9. Process Improvement: Analyze data and optimize the process. Project Outcome Interns will gain experience in the semiconductor industry, demonstrate a good understanding of the process module and able to do a presentation of the learning outcome. At the end of the internship, an overall report to summarize their learning experience with recommendations for improvement is required.

Job_Title: Intern - (SG Technology Development NVM & Specialty Projects)
Job_Descriptions: About GLOBALFOUNDRIES GLOBALFOUNDRIES is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique  combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GLOBALFOUNDRIES makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. GLOBALFOUNDRIES is owned by Mubadala Investment Company. For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com. Project Title: Embedded high-precision resistor for Automotive applications Project Objective / Purpose (Introduction) A high precision resistor has been an important discreet device in automotive applications. In this project, you will join the team that will integrate a discreet high precision resistor device into an integrated solution that will deliver a cost-saving solution, reduction of overall footprint of the final product with an excellent reliability performance. Project Description - To study the state of the art approaches for High Precision Resistor fabrication in Semi-conductor devices from technical journal references, including material/mechanical/electrical properties of the thin film resistor. - To assist on the High Precision resistor fabrication including characterization and further process improvement. - To do electrical characterization of the identified material to extract its material and electrical properties. - To analyze the electrical data collected through statistical and analytical methods to draw a conclusion. - To do reliability check of the fabricated resistors and devise further improvement to meet the automotive criteria Project Outcome Identify a path to integrate a high precision resistor as a GlobalFoundries value added offering to its end customer through data analysis, material characterization, process simulation, and wafer fabrication.

Project Title Lean Six Sigma - A Key Quality Tool in the Wafer Fabrication Process Project Objective / Purpose (Introduction) Wafer fabrication is the fundamental of all electronics and its applications in the semiconductor supply chain. Running a 24/7 operation, a Wafer Fab has to be efficient in operations and able to attain quality to fulfill the market's demand. Lean Six Sigma (LSS) is deployed as a Quality Management Methodology in GF to help increase productivity and improve quality. Project Description Interns will get to: 1. Partner with Black Belts in GF to design training materials for LSS Training Material, in line with corporate branding 2. Conceptualize and design company’s internal document designs (training materials, project templates, departmental website etc.) based on stakeholders’ request 3. Plan and launch marketing and publicity campaigns for awareness and exposure, such as but not limiting to poster designs, video making 4. Plan and set up various LSS training programs or Certification Ceremony that involve multiple departments, including video creation. Project Outcome Students will understand the concept of Lean Six Sigma and  apply the knowledge in actual business case in the semiconductor industry. At the end of the internship, an overall report to summarize their learning experience with recommendations for improvement is required.

About GlobalFoundries GlobalFoundries is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world’s most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GlobalFoundries makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets.  For more information, visit www.globalfoundries.com Project Title Data Scientist Machine Learning for effective monitoring and analysis of Etest Project Objective / Purpose (Introduction) Wafer fabrication is the fundamental of all electronics and its applications in the semiconductor supply chain. Everything starts off with a bare silicon substrate, which undergoes many processing tools and processes to form the ultimate IC chips that power up the electronics appliances. Process and tool performance are critical to ensure wafer quality. These performances must be closely monitored, controlled, and analyzed for improvements. A database with this information will help to provide a clear status overview. Project Description Students will get to learn: 1. Overview of the wafer fabrication process 2. Basis understanding of - Purpose/function of this process / tool module - Different types of processes / tool within the module 3. Controls used in this process / tool - The parameters being monitored 4. Review of process/tool data like processing time, tool preventive maintenance etc. 5. Able to consolidate and display the required data in some form of database for a more effective analysis Project Outcome Students will be tasked to extract and crunch data for a more effective data analysis. At the end of the internship, an overall report to summarize their learning experience with recommendations for improvement is required.

Job_Title: Assistant Marketing Manager, Brand, Campaign & Partnership
Job_Descriptions: A bout the role We’re looking for an Assistant Marketing Manager, Campaign & Partnership to lead media, campaigns and brand partnerships in Singapore. This role will work closely with the marketing team in Singapore as well as the global creative team (UK), as well as our external media & creative agencies to deliver best in class media strategy and campaigns that deliver against our goals. This role reports to the Head of Marketing, and is based in Singapore. A successful candidate will have a passion for all things media and campaigns and have a natural ability to think strategically to solve business problems. You’ll be experienced in executing large multi-channel marketing campaigns and have a broad knowledge and understanding of the marketing channel mix. You'll be a self starter, comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and able to ‘think big’ while paying careful attention to detail. This role is responsible for delivering high impact multi-channel campaigns and partnerships that deliver against Deliveroo’s business goals. What you’ll be doing Campaign development: Identify sharp consumer, product and market insights to fuel ideation, creation and execution of stand out integrated marketing campaigns. Work on the creation of large scale campaigns from ideation, to brief creation, through planning, creative development and launch. You’ll be responsible for working closely with the Head of Marketing to manage campaigns with our external creative agency partner and internal studio team to develop campaigns across all channels. Demonstrate media expertise: Manage our external media agency to plan, deliver & execute our national media strategy. Identify the most relevant channels and media mix to drive growth, identify the need to tailor locally and leverage restaurants in Singapore. Strengthen partnerships: Work with external partners to generate opportunities to acquire new customers to Deliveroo Demonstrate excellent stakeholder relationship : Work with diverse teams to deliver best in class marketing planning and campaign management. You’ll work closely with teams across the business including performance marketing, CRM, creative studio, PR to develop the optimum strategies & plans to drive relevance with our consumers. Take an analytical approach: Work with our business and consumer insights teams to develop robust measurement & effectiveness evaluations of our campaign. Requirements 3-5 years experience in marketing campaigns or agency experience running successful insight led marketing campaigns, with proven ability to manage large-scale media budgets Detail oriented executor. You're skilled at planning, organising, prioritising and executing simultaneous projects and activities at once. You can prioritise high impact activities and keep complicated projects moving forward. A self-starter attitude that’s comfortable with constant change and enjoys working in a fast-paced environment. Proven track record in making things happen - delivering results quickly and efficiently. A creative problem solver who can think things through analytically. A proactive, can-do attitude, full of great ideas and able to get stuff done autonomously. Great communication skills with a passion for building strong relationships, with proven experience to manage agencies as well as internal stakeholders and teams Benefits Become one of the key employees of a fast-growing, exciting startup changing the food delivery landscape Open, respectful and fun company culture Group & dependent insurance Growing family support Free Deliveroo plus One day of paid leave per year to volunteer with a registered charity Excellent learning and development opportunities, and access to LinkedIn Learning Access to Headspace, a meditation and wellbeing app and service Daily breakfast and healthy snacks and fruit in the office Regular social events A continuously evolving benefits offering Why Deliveroo? When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We’re a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride. Diversity and Inclusion At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation. In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company’s success. We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up’s around. Apply now to continue the conversation.

Business Oversight Compliance Officer - Markets Business Oversight Compliance Officer - Markets Singapore As a Barclays Business Oversight Compliance Officer within or Markets, you will have working relationship and interaction with various APAC Fixed Income business stakeholders, business managers, and infrastructure partners. You will be responsible for hosting regular meetings with business heads, supervisors, senior business management on compliance risk issues escalation, MIs, supervisory topics and focused compliance reviews and themes. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Providing day-to-day compliance advice/guidance to APAC Fixed Income businesses, including Credit, Prime Derivatives Services (PDS), Treasury Funding & Investments Working with Compliance colleagues in other APAC jurisdictions outside Singapore as well as Compliance colleagues in US and EME Working with the business and infrastructure partners to establish and maintain appropriate controls for effective compliance risk management Assisting with regulatory interactions with both regulators and exchanges, including managing inspections, completing risk assessment questionnaires Highlighting significant regulatory developments, rule changes and industry wide exercises to business/Stakeholders from the regular reviews Working closely with E-Communications and Trade Surveillance teams as needed Conducting verification checks to assess compliance with internal and regulatory and control requirements Working with partners in other compliance groups, including Country Compliance, Central Compliance, Financial Crime, Monitoring & Testing, Surveillance What we're looking for: Strong verbal and written communication, good interpersonal, influencing, and negotiating skills Demonstrated interest and ability to develop product knowledge expertise in relevant fixed income business areas Meticulous with details and yet with strong focus on big picture Comfortable multi-tasking and working in a flexible, collaborative team environment Skills that will help you in the role: Experience within a control function at an investment bank, such as Compliance, Audit, Legal, Risk, Business Management, or Controls Working knowledge of fixed income products and related control environment Awareness of key global and/or APAC regulatory rules, as well as market trends and key risk areas Able to work independently and as required, comfortable providing effective check and challenge to relevant stakeholders Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Who we are American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security. Get to know the business General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network. At AIG, technology is at the heart of everything we do, from underwriting risks to processing claims. The Information Technology team equips our employees with the latest tools to complete their work efficiently and with the highest standards of excellence. The team is responsible for shielding the company’s systems from security risks, while designing technology strategies that enable AIG’s businesses to achieve their goals. AIG’s Information Technology functions include application development and management, enterprise architecture, and technology risk and compliance. About the role What you need to know: The Head of APAC IT Regulatory is an integral leader in the Technology Risk and Controls (TRC) team. This position is responsible for being the subject matter expert in region for all IT regulations. The person in this role will manage compliance with all IT regulations (including Cyber security regulations, IT risk and the IT requirements for privacy regulations) across all 12 countries in region.  This leader will work closely with senior management across IT, Legal, Compliance, ERM and Internal Audit. The Head of APAC IT Regulatory will be the leader in region responsible for managing all IT regulations. Key responsibilities include: Manage Existing IT Regulations: Maintain an inventory of existing IT regulations across the region Periodically assess each existing regulation for continued compliance, identifying any gaps Work with Legal and Compliance to confirm interpretation of the regulation Create action plans to address gaps Monitor Action Plans, understanding where there are significant issues, and what can be done to address these issues, escalating as appropriate Identify and Address New IT Regulations: Identify new IT Regulations via Legal, or other sources Partner with Legal to agree on interpretation of the regulation Conduct an assessment to identify and potential gaps Create Action Plans to address these gaps, and confirm ownership Monitor Action Plans, understanding where there are significant issues, and what can be done to address these issues, escalating as appropriate Collaborate with Risk to understand emerging risks stemming from these regulations Manage IT Regulator Inquiries: Coordinate IT requests from regulators, obtaining responses from subject matter experts Review the responses to confirm consistent and accurate responses with an appropriate level of detail are provided Manage technology regulatory examinations and requests for information for technology and cyber (coordination, data collection, status reporting) Provide Regulatory Reporting: Provide project status reporting on coming into compliance with all new regulations Create regulatory reporting to monitor compliance against the regulations Work closely with counterparts globally to share Lessons Learned from APAC’s IT regulations to learn from what other regions have experience What we’re looking for: 10+ years of experience within technology risk, control and governance, IT Internal Audit disciplines Required: Bachelor’s degree Understanding of IT Risk principles and best practices Ability to oversee multiple processes, action plans and key stakeholders simultaneously Experience raising awareness of issues to key stakeholders across technology Core Skills Demonstrate effective leadership skills Clear, concise written and oral communication skills coupled with the ability to drive agreement using information and interpersonal acumen Proven track record of drawing conclusions, making decisions, and using data to solve problems Ability to define solutions from ambiguous scenarios Maintain excellent interpersonal and oral/written communication skills Active listener Ability to drive change through influence Excellent negotiation, collaboration, facilitation and coordination Negotiate prioritization and treatment of risk issues that span: Audit obligations Across various lines of business and shared service areas Excellent program, project and team Job_Title: VIE Singapour - Data Analyst Supply Chain
Job_Descriptions: JOIN OUR SUPPLY CHAIN TEAMS! Behind every great brand is a great story. At L’Oréal, ours began with a young entrepreneurial chemist, Eugène Schueller, producing and selling hair-dye from his kitchen. From these humble roots, we’re today a family of 88,000 employees, who collaborate across 150 countries and over 36 world renowned brands, with the goal of innovating and creating products that meet the infinite diversity of our consumers’ beauty needs and desires. While inventing the future of beauty is our passion, we’re doing it with a strong commitment to sustainability and environment in everything we do. And our ambition is to be the #1 BeautyTech Company. Fueling this roadmap is the Operations team at L’Oréal- 20,000 people strong, spread world-wide and orchestrating cutting-edge expertise across the entire value chain – from packaging and product development to sourcing, manufacturing, and supply chain. We are a bunch of very diverse individuals who absolutely love what we do and are excited by the real possibilities that data and technology are unlocking for us. Joining L'Oréal means being a part of a company that: Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build the future. Has chosen to uphold strong values regarding social and environmental points of view. Is constantly at the fore front of technology to respond to consumer demands for agility, personalization and new beauty experiences. WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE A PART OF THIS ADVENTURE? Join our Supply Chain team in the capacity of a Data Scientist/Analyst Supply Chain In the Supply Chain Center of Excellent at L’Oréal Singapore Supply Chain Center of Excellence is a new team built in SAPMENA (South Asia Pacific Middle East North Africa) to deliver transversal Supply Chain use cases that will drive the tech transformation of the group for the zone, covering all business and functional domains under a network of international hubs spread in 15 countries. As a Data Scientist working at the Center of Excellence, you will use your expertise in Machine Learning to solve problems with high business impact and deploy models at scale using cutting-edge technologies to grow our business on e-com and off-line. Join a multicultural team with experience along the full Supply Chain streams EACH DAY AS PART OF THIS TEAM, YOU CAN EXPECT TO: Work on data reports answering the needs defined by the business, analyze data issues and find the mitigation plans. Be in contact with multi streams data, touching the 18 domains of L’Oréal from Manufacturing to E-commerce. HERE’S HOW YOU WILL HAVE A ROLE TO PLAY IN IT: The data expert is responsible for the delivery of said reports through : Definition of the feasibility and implementation of use cases Understanding business needs and translate them to technical terms Developing, adapting, and executing reports for different country/deployment as needed Modelization, packaging and making assets available for key users Owning and managing the solutions, app, workspace, and reports repository THE SKILLS THAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED: HARD SKILLS: Data manipulation and analysis skills: Data wrangling, crunching, preparation, vizualisation Exploratory data analysis Experience in data vizualisation, knowledge or interest in Power BI Proficiency in web frameworks knowledge appreciated Python, R, Microsoft SQL Server, GCP knowledge are a MUST Familiar with MLOps tools: MLFlow, DVC, or similar frameworks SAP ECC and Supply Chains domains knowledge appreciated Fluency in English SOFT SKILLS: Capability to work with different Métiers An excellent communicator, you are rigorous, flexible and have profound analytical skills Great innovator skills Able to deal with a high operative workload Capable and passionate about working in an international environment Hybrid work modes: Remote & On-site Experience or Interest in Supply Chain IF YOU COME WITH AN EDUCATION BACKGROUND IN Applied Statistics/Mathematics, BE PART OF THIS RIDE! A BIT MORE ON OUR OFFICE LOCATION AND HOW TO ACCESS IT: Office Address : 1 George Street #19-01/03 One George Street, Singapore 049145. For security reasons, the l’Oréal office can only be accessed from Level 47, the lift will bring you directly to L47, accessibility and apps needed to access the building will be shared later on. ONCE YOU DECIDE TO APPLY, HERE’S WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT… Receiving an answer within 2 weeks of applying. If your CV is selected, you will have an HR interview with one of our recruiters. Post which, at least 2-3 rounds of technical discussions with the hiring team, as part of the overall process. If you had the opportunity to meet with a recruiter and we are unable to move forward with your application, you can expect to receive a prompt answer in one week with constructive feedback. We strongly value the time and energy you invest in us. Looking for more information? Read further: https://careers.loreal.com L’Oréal is committed to building a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. L’Oréal closely prohibits discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of the individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job_Title: SVP / VP, Behavioural Lead, Transformation Group (WD19904)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function: Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! Responsibilities Design and conduct research, with a mix of qualitative and quantitative methods. Carry out behavioural and service audits, reviews of existing products, services and customer journeys Drive scientific rigor and discipline into how DBS creates customer experiences through scientific and experimental approaches to design Be the go-to expert for testing Behavioural Design techniques in product development and customer journey management Produce thought leadership in the BE / BS space for internal and external channels, including maintaining expertise in emerging trends in the space Facilitate workshops and trainings that build BE / BS awareness and capabilities within DBS Requirements: Master’s / PhD in a field related to Behavioural Design preferred (e.g. Behavioural Economics. Behavioural Sciences, UX, Applied Anthropology) preferred but not required / Academic and product 6 - 10 years of relevant work experience Demonstrated success in deploying BD concepts to create business and strategic corporate environments Significant experience managing multiple-stakeholder environments Significant experience applying BD principles in consumer products and services environments, such as Qualitative and Quantitative Research methods, Design thinking, HCD, UX /UI, , customer journeys, gamification / games design. Experience working in Financial services / Fintech is a plus A self-starter and collaborator that flourishes in a fast-paced, ever-changing, and deadline-driven environment. This is a regional role, hence incumbent must have strong ability to manage multiple markets and multicultural teams Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Markets Client Manager - AVP / VP Job Purpose: A solutions driven role to help resolve on-boarding, documentation, regulatory or other infrastructure issues preventing our key customers either growing or enhancing business with the Markets division. Support Asia Pacific Financial Institution Solutions & Sales Management to address and resolve client issues pertaining to Legal Documentation (e.g. ISDAs/CSAs), KYC issues, Citi Collateral Guidelines (including their development and implementation), Onboarding Experience and regulatory initiatives. Coordinate with internal teams in developing and driving the client experience through the trade lifecycle from initial on-boarding & pre trade through to demarketing and client off-boarding The role will will focus on Citi's global markets platinum client requests by helping to manage, develop and drive the regulatory client on-boarding & documentation process to enable fast and efficient completion This is a unique and challenging role that provides exposure to clients, to various product and control groups as well as visibility from senior business leaders, with a focus on enhancing the client experience. Key Responsibilities: The primary function is to improve the service and experience offered to our Platinum and Priority customers across the region, ensuring the client receives a service that is seamless and structured to ensure efficiency. As stated this is a client solutions based role facilitating the management of the various documentation processes, Credit approvals and operational troubleshooting as necessary. As such the candidate will: Become the point of contact for our platinum clients s with respect to smooth transition of pre-execution process by ensuring coordination of KYC, Onboarding , Credit, Legal , regulatory and Operational efforts needed to get the client ready2 trade with Citi Self-starter with good knowledge and understanding of legal documentation (e.g. ISDAs, CSAs, GMRAs/GLSAs, etc.), the Current Banking Regulatory Environment (Dodd-Frank, EMIR, FATCA, etc.) and the ability to navigate the internal structure of a large global organization such as Citi Be the FLOD point of expertise for risk issues and drive risk knowledge transfer and awareness within the business with a focus on APAC. KYC/AML or Middle Office, Credit, Risk, On-boarding is preferred Act as a point of escalation/resolution for client impacting events such as risk, regulatory or legislative change. Work with legal and markets transformation team in repapering legal documents & ensuring a seamless transition to meet the regulatory requirements Develop and implement client driven solutions to enhance the client experience through the trade lifecycle by working closely with coverage bankers , sales and solutions and other business support function Knowledge/Experience & Qualifications: Ideal candidate will have 8-10 years' experience in financial services , legal or risk based background. Good exposure or previous experience in a client development, operations, relationship, risk or product management Broad range of Markets products such as Fixed Income, Equity, FX and Commodity Products, specifically but not limited to derivatives and financing transactions Knowledge of trade flows, infrastructure and CLM Counterparty Credit Risk experience preferred Documentation experience advantageous Good operational control, change management & customer interaction experience would also be a benefit Education : Degree preferred (Legal knowledge advantageous) Skills & Competencies Good PC skills essential to quickly learn the variety of in-house trading and related systems. Superior verbal and written communication skills Exceptional process and conflict management ability Highly motivated, self-starter who is able to work on own initiative Ability to prioritise multiple tasks based on materiality Fast thinker/quick learner, possess the ability to work effectively under pressure in a rapidly changing environment in order to meet tight deadlines. Able to manage routine processes with precision and ad hoc projects with flexibility and creativity Proficiency in MS office Suite. Versent is an Australian-born technology company, focused on architecting, building & operating cloud native applications, data streams, platforms and services. Our solutions are centred around AWS and best of breed technology. From a stand-still start in 2014, we've grown to over 400 Versentonians in just five years across Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Singapore and now Denver. With a diversified offering in professional services, managed services and product, we are poised for significant growth in 2022. The key purpose of the Principal Solution Architect (PSA) is a pre-sales role and you will be in charge of shaping and delivering solutions related to all things AWS and Azure Cloud within strategic key accounts. This is achieved through your deep subject matter expertise in the Cloud space. This role is also accountable for working closely with client deal teams to develop the solution for all client engagements and supporting pre-sales to delivery handover.  You will also be a credible Cloud subject matter expert partner in the sales process and will drive Versent’s growth strategy through effective client engagement, advisory and successful solutions. The experience we require: High level of technical and analytical knowledge in the relevant Cloud and proven experience in engineering and software architecture design. Experience in a customer-facing, sales-aligned role such as Consultant, Solutions Engineer or Solutions Architect In-depth understanding of coding languages Focusing on customer needs and satisfaction by setting high standards for quality & throughput, monitoring & maintaining productivity, working systematically & consistently achieving project goals Gains clear agreement and commitment from others by persuading, convincing and negotiating Applies specialist and detailed technical expertise and shares knowledge with others Analyses information for greater understanding of a problem to provide workable solutions and make rational judgements to a problem Work strategically to realise organisational goals and take into account a wide range of issues across and related to the organisation Ability to influence the discussion with clients and demonstrate how business outcomes can be achieved with recommended solutions Our Culture No cool cliques, just motivated passionate humans generating ideas and devising solutions in a creative, collaborative workspace. We're building a team and looking for people who can think outside the square and deliver what others might consider impossible. At Versent, we embrace the notion of Family: working together to achieve outstanding success. What we offer you At Versent we invest in our people, with benefits such as: ·       Competitive salary package. ·       Working in a flexible, outcome-driven environment. Outside of client obligations, you can work from the office or home as needed. Also, leave the suit and tie behind and put on a Versent T-shirt instead. ·       Weekly internal tech talks; all streamed and recorded so those who can’t make it to the office can still participate. For those who do make it, there’s pizza, beer, wine and soft drinks on tap. ·       Regular social events, meetups and guest speakers organised and facilitated by our team. ·       A supportive family culture. If you need help, just ask. ·       Celebration of the wins – big or small, because we know how hard you work. And finally, we believe that every human is equal, across every dimension, and we function as an unbiased meritocracy. We strive to have Inclusion front and centre in how we operate and embed the fundamentals of tolerance and understanding in everything we do. This core belief is woven into all our policies. Curious? Here is more about us – but honestly, we are more interested in you!

Job_Title: AVP, GTS-SME Regional Cards Commercialisation Manager IBG3&4 - Institutional Banking Group (IBG)
Job_Descriptions: AVP, GTS-SME Regional Cards Commercialisation Manager IBG3&4 - Institutional Banking Group (IBG) Business Function Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards. Responsibilities Drive business growth by executing the joint GTS-SME business strategy, by rolling out new products and by enabling the client facing sales teams to effectively sell the commercial card payment solutions: Superior Product Proposition: Develop and strengthen the SME Cards product propositions based on a deep understanding of client needs and processes. Commercialize the product solutions by comprehensively addressing the business needs of specific client segments. SME requirements are typically quite simple - accordingly package existing products to cater for ease of use and scalability. For different markets, there may also be a need for localization of these product packages. Sales Enablement: Implement processes to enable RM / Sales teams to have a clear understanding of the product propositions so that they can easily market these solutions to the relevant client segments. Provide training and marketing support to implement go-to-market plans and drive product usage. SME Scale-up: Implement plans to win additional market share and share of wallet. Drive actions to scale up the SME business via new client acquisition and product usage. Leverage data analytics to identify new leads. Use digital marketing and acquisition tools to enable clients to be onboarded quickly and efficiently. Develop and implement plans to gain greater business traction in markets like HK, Taiwan, Indonesia and India. Digital: Drive efforts to maximize the use digital channels for client acquisition, transactions, and ongoing engagements. Focus on providing a positive customer experience with immediate fulfilment wherever possible. Drive greater use of electronic channels like IDEAL and APIs to capture customers' transactional flows and operating business. Business development of ecosystem opportunities including marketplaces, supply chains, integrated ERP platforms or merchant solutions that allow us to capture new business opportunities at scale. Partnerships: Leverage partnerships with other product partners, ERP platforms, card networks, insurance partners and others to help deliver better solutions to our customers. Requirements Bachelors Degree in Business, Banking & Finance or a related discipline Experience in Commercial Card Product Management preferred Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Powerpoint Preferably relevant experience in SME banking environment Good interpersonal skills Ability to build good rapport both internally and externally and collaborate with partners across all levels of management. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment & communicate accurately and effectively Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Senior Marketing Executive - East / Collaterals / EDMs
Job_Descriptions: Manage Consent Preferences These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site.    All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance. Always Active These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms.    You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information. These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.    They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising. These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.    If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly. Job_Title: AVP, Marketing Technology, Conversion Optimisation Specialist , Consumer Banking Group - (WD31423)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. Responsibilities Deliver data-driven insights that inform, influence, and optimize marketing strategy and execution aligned with business objectives. Drive and manage comprehensive and advanced analytics that improves traffic generation and conversion across the sites(web & mobile) and platforms and actively report and improve respective Traffic Channels KPI's. Collaborate and support Performance Marketing, Country Marketing, Tech & Delivery team to drive Mar tech value proposition. Execute data-driven marketing use cases with countries by enhancing customer segmentation strategy through bringing together data, qualitative studies, customer research, customer motivations/ needs info, leverage marketing technology capabilities, connecting the dots across various initiatives to amplify business results. Implement a framework to balance personalization, data-driven marketing with evolving customer privacy landscape Closely collaborate with the country marketing team to share findings and insights on Traffic, Media, aligning deep dives for DBS channel forecasts, campaigns, and pre-post-mortems, traffic acquisition strategies & overall business objectives. Directly manage the efficiency, data-driven performance tracking capabilities in delivering a data-driven funnel analysis that can identify all digital engagements, lead acquisition, and customer journeys Proactive monitoring of the market for emerging technologies that can improve marketing performance and personalization. Understand business and technology requirements and connect the dots to deliver the MarTech strategy to fulfil business objectives. Develop best practices to share with in-country marketing teams in Singapore, India, Indonesia, China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong Be the interface between Marketing and Technology teams to build the capabilities related to MarTech, including evaluation, recommendation on build vs. buy, budgeting, testing, rollout, and governance Develop and implement data capabilities, consolidations, and best practice toolsets and frameworks that allow continuous tracking and optimization of web & mobile traffic. Identify, suggest and implement new opportunities to drive growth through traffic optimization. Drive Traffic analytics capabilities building through the application of the full set of advanced analytics methodologies to optimize data analysis. This includes framing of business needs, data, and KPIs exploration and benchmarking as well as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive modelling. Advise stakeholders in your area of responsibility on digital analytics to define goals, select appropriate KPIs, monitor performance and derive trends and opportunities. Qualifications Minimum 10 years of experience with 7-8 yrs of relevant experience in the marketing technology space and delivering value to marketing Strong digital analytics experience, preferably 4-6 years' experience using either Adobe experience cloud ,Google, CDP(Tealium audienceStream, Segment, AEP),DMP(AAM, Lotame, Google Audience Centre),Salesforce Marketing Cloud or equivalent MarTech knowledge. Bachelor's degree or above in any of the following disciplines: engineering, Statistics, Economics or Business Administration Proven ability to communicate insights and recommendations to senior stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, both in verbal and written formats Strong capability of managing and prioritising several competing tasks for different stakeholders Excellent analytical, technical and/or statistical skills with proven ability to translate large volumes of data into meaningful narratives An influencer who communicates clearly and frequently to both technical analysts and non-technical business leaders Intellectually curious, consistently seeking and developing new opportunities autonomously Growth mindset - eager to learn and try new things, adapt and thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Senior Assoc, Business / Data Analyst, Middle Office Technology, Technology & Operations
Job_Descriptions: Senior Assoc, Business / Data Analyst, Middle Office Technology, Technology & Operations Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Job Role The role is responsible for driving business and data analysis of internal systems and processes. Data Analyst works closely with respective business and technology counterparts to understand and document the innerworkings of the systemand/or a business process and applies the knowledge to solve problems at hand. They conduct data exploration workshops, analyse datasets, write user stories, perform testing, and work with development team on data projects. Position requires strong understanding of SQL and Data Models and is very hands on. Responsibility Lead and manage Data Analysis across different compliance solutions AML, KYC, CDD, Fraud and ensure all requirements have proper user stories, WBS and traceability Perform EDA - Exploratory Data Analysis using SQL, Spark, Hive, Presto Produce Jupyter Notebooks with Reproducible Analysis of datasets - Python, Scala, or SQL Produce Dashboards that clearly tell a Data Story - Tableau, Spark, Presto, Superset Leverage the subject matter experts across technology and business in delivering structured and well-thought through solutions Drive Data Discussions around Security, Compliance, Quality- know how to work with PII data in responsible way In depth knowledge of Atlassian products - Jira, Confluenceat a minimum Collect functional requirements from stakeholders, and able to document and explain the requirements to development and QA team Conduct in-depth customer analytics and develop data visualization to discover trends/patterns, spot outliers/gaps, and identify business drivers Be a persuasive storyteller to communicate business performance and data analytics to stakeholders Participate various data-driven projects Identify and document requirements in form of customer journeys and user stories. Work with business stakeholders in requirement prioritization and rationalization Requirement 7+years of experience in Data Analytics role with demonstrated track of generating value through data driven solutions Strong SQL coding skill is a must Experience with Big Data tech stack is a must-Spark, Hive, Presto, Superset, Python Strong understanding of Data Governance and Data Quality aspectsand toolingof Product Developmentis a must - Collibra, Trifacta Hands on experience with Tableau - must be able to develop dashboards and data stories from ground up Data analysis knowledge in core banking (Consumer / Corporate / Wealth) and/or compliance systemsis a big plus Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, business process modelling/mapping, methodology development, and data modelling Solid experience in building data pipelines / data engineering background, experience with building data pipelines using cloud services is a plus Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to come up with effective business strategies to drive business growth based on quantitative analysis Excellent presentation, analytical and communication skills Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

About Schlumberger: We are Schlumberger, the leading provider of technology and services to the energy industry. Throughout much of the oil and gas lifecycle in over 120 countries; we design, develop and deliver technology and services that transforms how work is done. We define the boundaries of the industry by unleashing our talented people's energy. We are looking for innovators to join our diverse community of colleagues and develop new solutions and push the limits of what is possible. If you share our passion for discovery and want to find out what you could really do, then here is the place to do it. Quality Engineer (QA/ QC/ $6000 + AWS + VB) Location: Benoi Company Transport Provided (Boon Lay) Salary Up to $6000 depending on experience AWS + VB Responsibilities Coordinate investigations to address deviations and non-conformances, working with relevant subject matter experts as needed to ensure corrective and preventive actions are completed and address root causes. Develop, implement and maintain relevant quality procedures in compliance with the Quality Management System (QMS) and client requirements as needed. Ensure compliance to internal and external management systems. Conduct audit processes internally and at suppliers, including planning, preparation, execution, reporting results, and remedial work plans. Develop and implement internal Quality Control Plans (QCP) including customer- and project specific QCPs. Participate in design reviews and criticality assessments of processes as input to QCP development. Verify and ensure quality requirements are met before release of product for shipment Contribute to Quality Improvement Plans internally and with suppliers. Acquire and analyze data across a spectrum of business environments to facilitate process analysis and improvements. Use metrics, reporting and process control tools to track, analyze and problem solve. Utilize statistical quality tools and techniques to lower total quality costs. Provide QMS training and ensure appropriate competency levels are maintained. Mentor Inspectors and Documentation Specialists. Continuously improve knowledge of customer expectations, supplier relations, risk management and improvement, industry standards, business systems, and planning and quality tools. Requirements: Min. 2 years working experience in a similar Quality Engineer role Investigation of nonconformances, performing root cause analysis, and ensuring suitable corrective and preventive actions are implemented Good understanding of key elements of a good Quality Management System, and able to perform audits to verify compliance is ideal If you possess relevant skillsets, do apply with an updated CV in word format. Bentley Systems invites talented individuals to join our high-performance team of Product Sales Engineers.  Product Sales Engineers handle inbound sales of assigned brands into accounts. This is a sales revenue-generating role supporting new and existing accounts with Bentley software products, services, training, and cloud offerings that help our users achieve their desired business outcomes. You will help grow the market share of assigned brands within your region.  Successful Product Sales Engineers will thrive in a fast-paced environment, are self-motivated, and will ideally have inside sales experience. Your Day-to-Day: Responsible for selling assigned brands to both net-new and existing users. Qualify and close transactional inbound and usage-based opportunities. Expertly use LinkedIn and other social media means to engage prospects. Supporting recruiting for Bentley events, seminars, conferences, and Channel partner events as required. Create effective business plans to prospect for net new business opportunities and drive sales in assigned territory to exceed quota. Develop relationships at various levels including C-Level, VPs, Directors with target accounts through the use of direct sales techniques and conduct virtual meetings. Develop a sales pipeline and forecast all revenue by effectively following the sales process and managing all opportunities in CRM. Adhere to the Bentley Sales Process fully utilizing SAP Cloud for Sales (C4S) as a daily sales tool and reporting system Promote our value proposition to designers, engineers, architects, contractors, and owners by providing technical solutions to help the customers meet or exceed business objectives. Maintain a detailed knowledge and understanding of all Commercial Offerings and Software Support Policies. High-level use and comfort utilizing social media and prospecting intelligence resources. Negotiate sales and/or service agreements. Maintain a high knowledge level of the company's solutions and services. What You Bring to The Team: Bachelor’s degree in Construction or Civil Engineering or Sales experience within the Construction Software Industry. Preferred minimum of one (1) year of experience with a software company in Inside Sales with a flair for communicating with accounts and maximizing the account’s outcomes and Bentley’s revenue. Familiarity with SYNCHRO or other similar products. A pleasant non-intrusive manner, positive attitude, eye for detail, resourceful and inquisitive. Self-starter, driven, and accountable. Proven ability to manage multiple initiatives and coordinate activities. Excellent English language and written communication skills and the ability to effectively present information to users and prospects via phone and web. Software proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and general business applications is required. Excellent cross-collaboration skills with various internal departments. Ability to discuss product values, positioning, differentiation, and highlights. Ability to showcase the product through canned videos if required. Ability to travel. “ Job Segment: Engineer, Construction, Civil Engineer, Engineering
