Job_Title: Head, Product Management, CES, Technology and Operations | (WD30425)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels The Cloud Engineering Services department is responsible for defining and ensuring the execution of the roadmaps related to the firm’s global cloud platforms. The Cloud Product Owner is responsible for working with the Cloud Enablement team, the Cloud Engineering team and all Cloud Stakeholders to define and ensure the delivery of the DBS public cloud roadmap, as well as the communication and discussion around this roadmap. As a Product Owner, you will therefore identify, document, prioritize and communicate the work that our Engineering teams need to deliver based on business demands (external stakeholders and application teams), compliance and security requirements, and technology market trend. You will also run some projects and initiatives with the PMO team who is reporting to you, host and organize the bank’s public cloud steering committee. Essential Functions of the Job: Roadmap management: Act as Product Owner contributing to business outcomes and roadmap definition, defining system roadmap required to meet core business outcomes and drive public cloud adoption. Create high quality features and user stories to deliver on those outcomes. Maintain the Product backlog using input from Stakeholders - both internal and external, responsible for the building, editing and maintaining of the team backlog covering all Agile aspects or way of working like epics, features, user stories, defects and bugs. Responsible for ensuring backlog is ready for iteration planning, acting as the subject matter expert on the details and priority of all items in the backlog. Provide thought leadership on how scenarios and features will be implemented across the firm. Ability to manage multiple releases concurrently. Stakeholder management Strong Stakeholder/customer management skills by developing and sustaining strong working relationships with business and infrastructure teams throughout the firm. Organize and host the different forums which are required by the function. This includes the public cloud steering committee and business technology teams. Ability to present and represent owned services to senior leadership as needed. Manages and publishes roadmaps to ensure Stakeholders are informed. Demand and delivery management Partners with product engineer and delivery teams to ensure deliverables are defined properly with appropriate acceptance criteria and ensuring final accepted products are of the highest quality. Ensures the ‘what’ is needed and 'why' based on business needs is clearly articulated so that the delivery teams can determine ‘how’ to deliver it. Working with the demand management team and stakeholders, prioritizes backlog and roadmaps based on stakeholder demand and Product vision. Manages trade offs between scope and schedule with business demands and ensures business value is being delivered in concert with stakeholders like platform sponsors, program management and risk functions of the department. Accountable for business use case gathering and definition. Accountable for Definition of Acceptance Criteria and User Stories to ensure the delivery team is empowered with the necessary information. Participate in team demos and retrospectives, accepting quality work while ensuring constant process improvement throughout the lifecycle. Coordinate dependencies across product lines with the product management team. Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities: Proactively identifies and addresses strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats Makes key decisions based upon input from Managers and Leaders; solid understanding of IT Services principles; firm and business objectives and needs analysis Proactively anticipates problems before they occur; defines the problem; identifies possible causes; works with team to identify solutions; selects and implements most appropriate solution Applies judgment in implementing methodologies, processes, and practices to specific requirements of projects/programs which may include product design engineering, information security, code maintainability and reliability Clarifies goals, roles and responsibilities, work breakdown in complex situation involving different teams and departments or exploratory subjects. Knowledge and Skills Requirements: Demonstrated experience delivering results in an ambiguous and changing environment, the ability to work independently and be a self-starter. Ability to function effectively under pressure in environments of rapid change and conflicting demands and crisis management Demonstrated continuous improvement, quality methodology and project/operations delivery skills Strong leadership skills and demonstrated creative problem-solving skills Demonstrated strong quantitative, analytical and conceptual thinking skills Excellent communication skills across; ability to communicate complex, technical concepts to executive staff, business sponsors and technical resources in clear concise language Strong customer management and negotiation skills and the ability to mediate opposing viewpoints and articulate the advantages of standards in a technical environment Exceptional ability to collaborate, openly communicate, present and negotiate effectively across disciplines, vendors, partners, and customers. Education: Bachelor or Master’s degree or equivalent work experience Experience: Minimum 15 years’ experience as a product owner or program manager Minimum 8 years’ experience with Agile/SAFe framework Experience with cloud technologies such as GCP/AWS Experience in IT security and compliance

Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: 5 years of experience working in sales 3 years of experience in sales managerial and sales coaching Experience in driving a culture of coaching and practice Preferred qualifications: Coaching certification 10 years of experience in sales 5 years of experience in sales leadership, management, and coaching Knowledge of Google products and sales methodology About the job We strive to create a sales culture where our promoters embody the Google way of promoting. As a company, we have some of the most advanced advertising products created, partners that actively seek our guidance, and an incredibly talented sales team. As the Head of Sales Excellence, your main focus will be to augment and extend the current efforts focused on the Google way of promoting to grow core sales skills for Asia Pacific (APAC) Large Customer Sales (LCS) focused on areas including discovery, pitching, objection handling, and closing. You'll start with a needs analysis and institute a plan that helps our teams to organize the questions they ask, the stories we share, and importantly instills a culture of practice. You will have support, access, and visibility of the APAC LCS leadership team to provide sponsorship, drive mutual accountability, and deliver positive outcomes that justify the program (i.e. increased in pitch, agreement sizes, etc.). Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. Resposibilities Build a focused coaching plan for the APAC LCS organization with executive alignment on strategy. Lead a team that will deliver one on one and one on many coaching sessions for a dedicated portion of business for which each coach is assigned. Participate in events with a focus on coaching and practice (i.e. a team offsite). Set clear expectations on workflow and capacity to ensure your team’s resources are being fully utilized and maximized. Deliver outcomes that impact business growth and have strong manager/promoter feedback as measured by customer satisfaction score, confidence change, and influence on key metrics (pitch, business growth, etc.). Measure and share progress against coaching program (i.e. through dashboard reporting as well as monthly/quarterly updates).

Job_Descriptions: M&A Vice President, Global Schools Group, Singapore REFERENCE: 10605 /35S We are working with a global education group that has been rapidly expanding in recent years. With a portfolio consisting of some of the most well-recognised schools globally, this is an impressive group with ambitious growth plans. They are looking for a highly ambitious individual to join and assist in all M&A activities. This role will involve sourcing potential acquisitions internationally, meeting with management and working on the acquisition process alongside the head of M&A. RESPONSIBILITIES: Sourcing and appraising potential acquisition targets through management meetings Work actively with the team to lead on M&A YOUR PROFILE: Self-starter, with the ability to work independently and productively, and thrive in a loosely-structured environment Prior experience within private equity or corporate development, or potentially corporate finance or investment banking Proven origination experience and ability to build deal pipeline across Asia Ability to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment, and the ability to build strong rapport with management teams Excellent communication skills and attention to detail

Job_Title: Tech Partner Lead, Agency and Third-Party Partnerships
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 10 years of experience with marketing technology, advertising sales, digital media and marketing sales/product specialism. Preferred qualifications: Experience in driving new business and/or account management experience in online advertising/partner ecosystem. Knowledge of Google data, tech, and measurement capabilities across ad and media platforms including Google Ads, Search Ads 360, and Analytics. Demonstrated ability to influence and communicate cross-functionally and externally. Ability to have a strategic and analytical sales approach, with a focus on building relationships with clients. Excellent project management and analytical skills, and demonstrated ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively. About the job Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. Our Agency Partner team's mission is to advance our Partner ecosystem as one cohesive team and bring the best of Google to achieve our joint business goals. We intend to build and grow a partner ecosystem and drive scaled adoption and maturity of Google's digital marketing solutions in Southeast Asia and South Asia Frontier markets. Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences. Resposibilities Be a technical relationship owner by working collaboratively with Partner Managers to develop plans that enable technical excellence and capability development of partners. Design, plan and execute Partner Technical Plans (PTPs) in close alignment with Partner’s business objectives and Google’s product priorities. Drive commercial agreements with partners and support technology, media, creative, measurement components of joint business plans through partners. Expand sustainable tech partner supply and certification planning and drive partnerization of tech activation. Enable sales teams to scale technology solutions and build internal and external capability on tech products, partnerization, and privacy.

Job_Title: SVP, Agile Chapter Lead, Transformation Group | (WD28256)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function: Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! Responsibilities Establish the Agile Chapter (Business, Technology) Scaffolding Structure and high level roadmap year on year for its build and evolution and management reporting on its progress Define and implement data driven metrics to assess performance of the strategy Co-create curriculum to suit the Agile related job families with Platform and HR teams Create a federated framework for the co-creation and running of agile guilds for key roles Identify agile federated investment and align to maximise bank spend on enablement areas Enable a clear roadmap for enabler technologies supporting the Chapter including guidance to Digital for Agile Product Owner Drive a continuous improvement cycle across adoption problem areas and find solutions to enterprise blocks Leverage marketing and communications to create an active and engaging community and knowledge repository Explore external best practices and adopt as appropriate Requirements: 5+ Experience in one of the key agile roles + Minimum 7 years experience in Scrum, Kanban, SAFE, DevOps, Lean or Systems Thinking Experience in the development and buildout of capability and evaluation frameworks for job families Leadership experience, stakeholder management, and ability to influence and drive change at strategic levels with minimal supervision Transformation experience seeing from start to finish of sizeable area Ex-consultancy experience highly desirable or proven experience in building out frameworks and driving change through internal organisations Systematic and disciplined approach to planning, organising work, decision making and delegation Skilled at retrospectives at enterprise level, synthesising information and formulating action plans Ability to lead small team and large virtual team of stakeholders Experience in driving stakeholder forums eg. governance, guilds, etc.

We have a team of dedicated, experienced investment advisors who identify opportunities in the various asset classes and employ the best strategies and product vehicles to cater to each client's needs. Coupled with partnerships within the DBS network and with global institutions, we strive to build long-term relationships with our Private Banking clients in Asia by providing them with high quality, timely and extensive wealth management, investment and financial solutions. Job_Title: Technical Program Manager, Global New Product Introduction
Job_Descriptions: Minimum qualifications: 5 years of experience in program, project, and product management through Product Life Cycle processes. Experience with technical program management on cross-functional projects. Experience driving cost benefit analysis and return on investment calculations across products. Preferred qualifications: Master's degree in business, engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Experience with new product introduction and leading program rollouts. Experience working in data centers and building out infrastructure. Experience being involved in design specifications of Data Center facility and product designs and electrical, mechanical, and industrial engineering. About the job A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you’ll use your technical expertise to lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish. You’ll work with stakeholders to plan requirements, identify risks, manage project schedules, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. You're equally comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical tradeoffs in product development with engineers. Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company. As a Technical Program Manager, you will lead exploration, development, pilot, validation, deployment, and growth of new products enabling global data centers. You will deliver on design and reliability goals, shepherding products through their product lifecycle process on a schedule and budget, across all existing and new global sites, focusing on environmental sustainability and cost-effectiveness. You will deliver on a continued roadmap for products within your designated area. You will also be the POC and interface to cross-functional partners for your product portfolio, inspiring innovation in the data centers that help to keep the world’s internet humming 24/7, delivering results that have a major impact on the current and future success of Google. Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible. Resposibilities Drive cross-functional Product Development with velocity, simplicity, cost, and new tech-insertion considerations with purpose. Lead and influence others, as part of projects or programs, fostering relationships, trust, and collaboration. Manage large-scale design program and project plans within your designated area from inception through completion following product life cycle strategies. Lead project meetings (kickoffs, weekly program, take meeting minutes, provide status updates), manage project resources, budgets, schedules, scopes of work, risk management, and communications plans. Ensure the validation and verification of products align to all key performance indicators and provide visibility to all partners and stakeholders on progress.

Hiring_Company: Human Made, makers of Altis DXP
Job_Descriptions: Although this listing shows Singapore as its primary location, we are interested in seeing applicants coming from all over GLOBE, as we are currently scaling our Engineering teams across all regions. About You Human Made is looking for Web Engineers with WordPress experience to join its engineering team. This is a remote position - you can be based anywhere in the world. Engineers at Human Made work on enterprise-level projects for clients across the globe. We deliver digital experiences through our platform Altis DXP. Past and current clients include big media agencies, financial organisations, charities and not-for-profits, and other enterprise companies. You will be working on technically-complex client projects with a team of experienced Engineers and Project Managers from around the world. Your experience should include building custom solutions , understanding and incorporating security practices , and considering performance implications . You should also have knowledge of modern web technologies and best practices, including semantic HTML and modern CSS . You need to have strong experience building either PHP or JavaScript applications , and will be expected to skill up to a similar level in the other language. You should also have a solid understanding of MySQL and the considerations of database-driven applications , or be expected to get those skills on the role. As Human Made develops large-scale WordPress sites, WordPress experience is preferred, but not essential. If you do not have WordPress experience you will be expected to gain and develop this on the job. You should be familiar with the tools required for engineering projects. This includes a good understanding of Git, conflict resolution, local development environments, PHP configuration, following coding standards and general computer maintenance and security. You should be willing to adapt to the established processes in Human Made. The full job description for a Web Engineer at Human Made can be read in our company handbook. We also strongly encourage you to learn more about the hiring process before applying on the following links: The Hiring Process: What to Expect Pre-Application Checklist Your Application: Outcome and Feedback About Us Human Made helps organisations drive customer engagement, reinforce brand value and improve operations with digital solutions powered by Altis, our WordPress digital experience platform. Over the past 10+ years, we’ve helped brands such as Snopes, Siemens and USA Today build and deliver their digital strategies, transforming the way people interact with some of the most visited websites in the world. We have deep expertise and investment in using WordPress as a tool to create large-scale platforms, websites, and applications that drive transformational business value. Our decade of experience in agile delivery and passion for open source solutions supports clients in their journey to embrace the edge of innovation. Human Made is a fully distributed company, with employees based remotely around the world. Human Made is a remote company: this means you will need to work both independently and as part of a remote team. You will have the opportunity to meet the rest of the company at our annual company meetup, and with members of the rest of your team at least once a year. We care about good communication and you should be able to prioritise your work and meet deadlines, discussing any problems with the team along the way. You can learn more about Human Made and what you can expect working here in our public company handbook. Requirements In-depth understanding of engineering with JavaScript and/or PHP Good understanding of WordPress (this is preferred, but may be developed on the job) Ability to develop with Gutenberg (desired, not essential) Ability to debug your own code and that of others Experience in using debugging tools Strong understanding of HTML5 & CSS Experience in versioning technologies such as Git Knowledge of interacting with RESTful APIs Ability to set up local development environments Strong written communication skills Ability to manage your workload and juggle multiple tasks Benefits Competitive salary by local market standards Flexible working 52 weeks parental leave 35 days holiday Sickness and carers leave Annual company retreat Conference and training budget Monthly remote working allowance Work wherever you want New mobile phone every two years New computer when you need it Office equipment when you need it *Human Made is a remote and globally distributed organization. However, due to the remote nature of our team, we can’t provide any legal sponsorship to attain a work visa or permit in your country of residence, nor in any of the countries where we operate. We strongly advise you to seek legal counsel to ensure your residential status is fully legal before you apply.

Job_Title: Educational Technology Trainer ASIAPAC (International Growth & Revenue Team)
Job_Descriptions: Have you always wanted to unite your passion for learning with your skills as an Educational Technology Trainer? Do you want to work with an incredible team that is making an impact on learning around the world? If you answered yes, we can't wait to meet you! We're looking for an Educational Technology Trainer (remote position) based in the ASIAPAC region to work remotely for Edpuzzle, a leading edtech company trusted by over 80% of schools in the USA and millions of teachers and students across the globe, with offices in San Francisco and Barcelona. The right person will help us communicate with, train, and engage teachers and coaches within the schools in ASIAPAC. The role requires particular expertise in curriculum and technology integration. The goal of the Educational Technology Trainer is to focus on International Schools projects assigned, develop training and support material, and coordinate and lead trainings for staff including teachers, tech coaches, and curriculum coordinators throughout targeted schools, as well as be the Edpuzzle representative in both online and face to face events. If you’re looking for a meaningful role on a small team, you’ll feel right at home with us. In joining us, you’ll have a front-row seat at one of the fastest-growing companies in educational technology with a social impact. In the process, you’ll be challenged daily, learn constantly, see the impact of your opinions and work, and grow as an EdTech Trainer. Responsibilities Provides direct instruction of standards-based lessons to specialists and educators, and facilitates implementation of school wide technology projects. Work with other specialists to design training for new and continuing teachers in the use of technology integration available to support instruction. Prepare lesson plans, training materials and tutorials for International Schools supported programs based in the ASIAPAC region. Assists school or group of schools level and building level specialists, teachers, administrators, and other staff as necessary to understand content area needs, innovations, strategies, etc. Serve as a model by demonstrating lessons in the library resource center or classroom when appropriate. Develop online learning opportunities and professional development activities for staff across schools and groups of schools. models direct, explicit systematic instruction including effective teaching techniques and strategies. Participate in online and offline events representing Edpuzzle across the ASIAPAC region. A typical week Coordinate with account executives and Edpuzzle team members to deliver excellent training sessions with IT coaches, curriculum leaders, or school administrators within the assigned schools and groups of schools. Develop, coordinate, and customize training materials for each assigned school. Coordinate and lead remote training sessions with elementary, middle, and high school teachers. Coordinate and lead training sessions with schools tech coaches and coordinators. Coordinate and lead training sessions with district curriculum coordinators. Attend and speak at conferences. Follow the Edpuzzle Trainer Guide to deliver excellent training and carry out follow-ups with the schools to ensure Edpuzzle’s quality standards. Maintain strong pipeline management & log activities, as well as track success of training sessions in coordination with Edpuzzle team members. About remote positions Work remotely from the comfort of your own home or chosen workspace. Receive guidance from your manager & ask all the questions you need. Meet with your manager on a weekly basis to review status & brainstorm new projects to accomplish goals. Set daily tasks with your manager initially, over time becoming more autonomous & proactive in proposing new ideas to reach goals. Requirements More than 5 years of successful classroom teaching experience and training other colleagues in the use of edtech tools. More than 3 years of successful experience presenting in conferences and leading school professional development sessions, as well as experience creating video tutorials and engaging content for teachers. Resourceful: know how to keep pressing forward and organizing events/webinars for teachers. Excellent communication skills: email, phone & face-to-face conversations Flexible & able to adapt to new strategies. Clear passion for training other educators. Self-motivated: you have the ability to stay on-task while working alone. Strategic thinker: unafraid to use data to problem-solve, inform decisions & persuade Team-player: you look for ways to learn from & help your teammates. Unintimidated by new technology & quick to pick up new skills. Bonus Skills Google Trainer, Google Innovator, MIE Expert or Apple Distinguished Educator. Experience using Edpuzzle. Other Languages. Travel This position may require travel among building locations and districts Benefits Competitive salary and a substantial yearly salary review. A fun, friendly team of highly motivated people with different skill sets and backgrounds. Macbook laptop. Flexible working hours and Friday reduced working time. 23 vacation days, plus 24th and 31st December, and April 23. Edpuzzle is an equal opportunity employer, and we highly value diversity at our company. If you'd like to be considered for this position, please apply below. We look forward to meeting you!

Who are we? We are a deep tech satellite communications company with over $100M worth of investment in our first product, launching in 2022. Our major shareholders include Boeing – the world’s largest aerospace company and SES – the largest satellite operator by revenue. The space industry ground segment has always operated with one single antenna/terminal, capable of delivering only one connection to a single satellite and relied upon geosynchronous satellites. Isotropic Systems’ next-generation satellite terminal offers many simultaneous connections from a single terminal ("multi-beam"), whilst on the move, without ever-increasing the antenna cost to manufacture or compromising on performance. In-house manufacturing is achieved using state-of-the-art facilities at world-class Engineering Campus in Reading. We’re delighted that our diversity, inclusion and equality efforts have been recognised by Microsoft for Start Ups as we were finalists in the Diversity in Tech Awards 2020 for Cultural Inclusion. Requirements Isotropic Systems (ISL) is seeking an exceptional Sales Engineer to join our Sales Engineering team. The Sales Engineering team is responsible for technical product introduction, sales, and onboarding of new and existing customers and after sale customer support. As a member of the Sales Engineering team, you will leverage your experience providing technical sales support, assist in developing new applications, and deliver field demonstrations in support of product sales. Job Duties & Responsibilities: Work with sales directors and customer account managers to respond to technical questions from both existing and prospective customers Investigate, document, and coordinate product issues with other departments to ensure problems are addressed quickly and customer impact is minimized Act as an escalation point for the Customer Support team in diagnosing and ultimately resolving client issues Prepare, update, and maintain high quality technical documentation Improve and develop test tools to remove technical barriers to customer adoption Prepare, update, and deliver professional training materials to Isotropic Systems customers and partners Troubleshoot VSAT systems, including software/hardware integration Ability to work independently at customer sites to investigate, diagnose, and resolve satellite terminal problems Must have strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively and collaboratively across internal and external organizations Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies, learn quickly, and shift priorities in an ever-changing and fast-paced environment Excellent customer service skills with the ability to manage obstacles and address multiple and sometimes conflicting demands Ability to maintain professionalism, composure, credibility, and enthusiasm and positively influence others Ability to take complex technical topics and explain them to non-technical audiences Self starter that can manage multiple priorities, take initiative and work independently Proficient with Microsoft Office tools and applications Experience & Education Requirements / EEO Bachelors degree in Electronics/Electrical Engineering required; Masters degree preferred 8+ years of experience working in an Electronics/Electrical Engineering, Satcom Engineering, Sales Engineering, or related role is required Relay technical information from customers and partners to both technical and non-technical stakeholders within ISL, including Customer Requirements. Job Requirements: Candidates with previous experience in the following are highly desired: • Satellite Antenna or Satellite-based designs • Implementing satellite communication industry standard protocols • Experience and/or knowledge of the following is a plus: • Working with laboratory equipment for testing and troubleshooting, spectrum analyzers, signal generator etc . • Understanding of TCP/IP fundamentals (DNS, FTP, SSH, IP CONFIG), network architecture, and connectivity troubleshooting Benefits Competitive salary and benefits will be associated to this position.

Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading IT solution and service provider headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. The homegrown company was founded in 1997 with the mission of positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. We offer quality, cost-effective and impactful IT solutions and services, including mobile and web applications and cloud technology. Over the years, we have helped government agencies and enterprises remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency to better serve the communities. To amplify our efforts in improving people’s lives, Activate also develops preventive healthcare solutions that serve to increase health awareness and improve population health. We believe that the success of a company relies on the strengths of our employees. At Activate, we are committed to provide a conducive environment and develop our employees to realise their full potential. From a three-person outfit, Activate has grown into a team of more than 150 employees, delivering more than 150 solutions and services to help our clients achieve growth and success. Responsibilities Design, develop and maintain the testing environment, testing framework, test plan, regression test suites and test cases in accordance with changing requirements Support writing of automation test scripts Conduct various tests such as Manual/Automated/Functional/Exploratory testing/Cross-Platform Testing for the various platforms (iOS, Android, Web) Conduct system integration tests with external systems and generate test reports Responsible for finding and logging defects. Implement Agile testing practices and tools Support Quality initiatives and follow QE practices Keen eye for detail and good communication skills. Requirements Diploma in computer science or its equivalent At least 1-2 years’ experience in Test Automation for web-portal and mobile devices. Experience in manual and automation testing for web-portals and mobile applications Understands basics of test design and estimation. Abie to work under minimal supervision and commit to the tester agreed deliverable and schedule Knowledge about Appium and Selenium automation scripting Passionate in learning and working with new technologies. A natural tenacity, resiliency and determination. Willing to relocate to Singapore when necessary Good to have: Working knowledge of Robot Framework (using Python language) Experience in automated testing tools/frameworks (e.g. Cucumber, Selenium, Appium, Robot Framework) Experience of testing in Agile or conventional SDLC Good interpersonal and communication skills, motivated, good attitude, responsible and proactive Benefits If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you!

Location: Singapore, Singapore Thales people architect solutions that enable two-thirds of planes to take off and land safely. We create in-flight entertainment systems that engross 50 million fliers every year and we develop the avionics that control the world’s largest commercial aircrafts. Our simulators train the next generation of pilots for fighter jets, transporters and search and rescue helicopters. And, together, each and every member of our aerospace team makes a difference. Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas. Job Responsibilities: You will be a part of the worldwide team of RPA Developers contributing to worldwide and local development of RPA scripts. Work with Process and Product Owners to design, develop and test the automation workflows through deployment of bots, logging tools, dashboards, etc. Organize and support the launch and implementation of RPA solutions locally and internationally Create process and user documentations Assist Business and Process Owners in the construction of business cases and opportunity identification to further advocate and support adoption of RPA solutions in the organization Support the Project Manager and/or Product Owner in managing timeline, deliverables, budget, quality of the solutions Seek best practices, and continuous improvement within and outside of the Process & Tools department Provide data and reports linked to the development and implementation (run) of the solutions Requirements: Degree/Diploma in Engineering or equivalent Minimum 3-4 years of relevant working experience for senior position Experience in RPA development using UiPath Studio and UiPath products, SQL and relational databases, and application development Experience in process analysis, design and implementation; management of UAT and bug fixes Experience with manufacturing/industrial operations is an advantage SDLC experience in Scrum and Agile project methodologies Possess good interpersonal skills and customer focused Strong and focused team player in an international team Have strong problem solving and analytical skills At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!

Job_Title: VP/SVP, Retail Banking Audit - International Bank

Job_Title: SVP - Team Lead - Energy Renewables Infrastructure | (WD30491)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards. Responsibilities Lead, mentor and motivate a team of 4-5 global industry coverage bankers, with candidate being directly responsible for the team’s portfolio P&L performance across the following key products: Loans, Cash, Trade, Treasury and Markets and Investment Banking products (including Equity Capital Markets, Debt Capital Markets and Strategic Advisory) and across DBS geographies; Grow portfolio earnings and enhance portfolio ROE through cross-sell of Cash, Trade, Treasury & Markets and Investment Banking products and solutions as follows: Oversee the development and execution of strategic account plans for existing client portfolio with product partners, with at least semi-annual reviews, and a special focus on; The Digital agenda: To acquire new cash management mandates & supply chain mandates, working closely with product partners to ensure proper execution of such mandates; The Sustainability agenda: To capture sustainability advisory, loans and capital markets opportunities working closely with Sustainability Team. Identify New-To-Bank client targets and develop/implement acquisition plans Work with the Executive Directors and Managing Directors of ERI to originate investment banking and advisory mandates Ensure proper management of existing portfolio of customers across products and geographies, especially for large accounts with heavy demands on day-to-day operational handling.. Work with DBS Geographies to grow DBS ERI brand and regional industry wallet revenue by raising awareness of industry developments and its ensuing opportunities and risk, deal flow and deal structures. Jointly target new clients and drive joint account planning for existing portfolio Ensure regular client engagement at both the working level as well as C-suite meetings. These should be supported by timely pre-meeting briefing notes with relevant talking points and actionable call reports Ensure quality, accuracy and relevance of pitches to clients by product partners Lead the monthly preparation of Mid-Month Reviews to Senior Management detailing P&L and risk profile of the portfolio, ensuring accuracy of data and quality of analysis to drive direction of portfolio. Proactive monitoring and management of accounts, being alert to credit deterioration or improvement, and taking timely action including elevation to senior management and Credit. Oversee the preparation of credit memos ensuring accuracy, timeliness and supported by sufficient depth of analysis and synthesized insights and coherent recommendations. Ensure timely and accurate credit reviews of the whole portfolio; Evaluate financial models with P&L, B/S & cash-flow projections based on sound business and market assumptions with high level of competence. Oversee loan & security documentation and negotiation with high degree of competence Cultivate a strong people culture, with DBS values and building a highly-motivated team. Develop and monitor clear KPIs, with clear development goals for each direct report Drive talent development and internal mobility including overseas assignment. Craft action plan to address areas revealed by DBS’ employee engagement scores and ensure timely follow-up of such actions Requirements Bachelor Degree with at least 12 years' relevant experience. Previous working experience in Energy, Renewables & Infrastructure industry will be a pre-requisite. Good knowledge of various financial solutions products especially in driving regional business and connectivity across different geographies Good understanding of credit risks and ability to independently conduct discussions with credit / risk management teams would be preferrable Confidence in pitching ideas at the level of the CEOs and CFOs Highly resourceful individual who should also be a team player Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Basic Function and Scope of the Position: Responsible for supporting product transfer, instrument manufacturing, quality improvement, process enhancement, cost reduction, engineering evaluation and system improvement.  The Engineer will have primary responsibility for driving overall instrument quality performance and compliance throughout the organization by defining, implementing and maintaining the validation program.   The engineer is also responsible for risk assessment, strategy development, execution & commissioning of day to day sustaining and product validation activities. Tasks and Responsibilities: Develop and execute IQ, OQ and PQ protocols for product, processes, facilities, software and equipment within the facility. Write reports summarizing results and statistics for all validation projects. Review existing validation reports and identifies gaps for compliance.  Develop strategies and plans to close the gaps in an efficient and technical manner. Develop and communicate expectations for quality performance, continuous improvement, quality systems, process controls infrastructure for critical sustaining parts and new products. Monitor and drive corrective action and continuous improvement activities that directly impact validation performance measures. Provide day-to-day support to development, engineering and manufacturing for design control planning and design transfer activities. Work with end users and process owners to collect data to support protocol requirements, analyze data collected and create validation reports.   Coordinate with end users and process owners to resolve any identified issues to bring validation to acceptable levels. Coordinate with end users and process owners to lead development of validation protocols. Participate in project management meetings as Validation representative determining validation requirements, as needed. Support and drive activities to ensure successful product transfer into manufacturing. Support instrument setup, calibration and final system integration test. Sustain databases of instrument validations activities (Valgenesis and Internal Team Shared folder). Learn and understand the applicable technology and engage in technical discussions. Identify areas and opportunities to improve manufacturing facilities, processes and equipment. Collaborate and provide consultation to other departments performing validation activities Coordinate with Validation, Engineering and Quality Teams to collect and analyze existing validation deliverable for Instrument systems and processes Ensure compliance with Validation procedures and Illumina’s Quality Management system Ensure validation program meets requirements of FDA and ISO Provide guidance and supervision to junior staff. All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities. Preferred Educational Background: Requires a Bachelors, Masters or PhD. degree in engineering or science with a minimum of 5 years of related working experience. Preferred Experiential Background: Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and accuracy, and the ability to work independently in a team environment are essential. Candidate must be able to interface well with the manufacturing and service organization and has a proven track record of transferring products to manufacturing. Demonstrated ability to accomplish goals while working across departments is required. Demonstrated strong analytical problem solving (CAPA), team and communications/interpersonal skills/good analytical and troubleshooting skills. Proficient in engineering tools such as, statistical analysis, design of experiments, product, FMEA and Risk Analysis and process capability analysis. Experience in the biotech instrument, medical device/IVD industry in the development and deployment of Quality Systems, and process controls, and continuous improvement methods. Knowledge and working application of FDA cGMP; ANSI/ISO/ASQC; CMDAS requirements. Knowledge and working application of Validation Principles and guidelines and industry practice. Computer competency in Word, Excel, Power Point, Statistical Software and databases Experience with statistics, Statistical Process Control and DOE techniques is a plus. Job_Title: Digital Product Test Development Engineer (2022 New Grads)
Job_Descriptions: Company: Qualcomm Global Trading Pte. Ltd. Job Area: Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Hardware Engineering General Summary Company Profile: Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. (QTI) is a world leader in 3G, 4G, 5G and next-generation wireless technologies and a leading developer and innovator of advanced wireless technologies and products. In order to drive our next phase of growth in Automotive, we are expanding the Product Development and Test Engineering group at our Test Center of Excellence (TCE) in Singapore. The Product Development and Test Engineering group develops test solutions for design verification of highly integrated SoC chip for Automotive application. We work with Design, System, Foundry, Program Management, Yield, Reliability, Marketing, Sales and Manufacturing teams to create, commercialize and support QTIs products. The Product Development and Test Engineering group develops test solutions for design verification of highly integrated SoC chip for mobile application. We work with Design, Foundry, Program Management, Yield, Reliability, Marketing, Sales and Manufacturing teams to create, commercialize and support QTIs products. Major Responsibilities: Job responsibilities for the position include designing and debugging of test interface HW (loadboard), test SW (test program) development, HW/SW integration, characterization plan development, first silicon debug, process experiment (split) definition, multiple-source fab matching, device characterization, data analysis, product documentation/presentation, test limit (guardband) generation; driving failure analysis to completion, yield variance control. The job scope also requires the engineer to drive for short term and long term test time reduction and yield improvement to meet set goals without compromising production quality for multiple projects in parallel. Min Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred Qualifications Strong working ATE knowledge (Advantest 93K ATE is preferred) and experience in developing ATE SOC program from NPI stage to volume ramp stage. Good understanding in semiconductor Functional testing and power measurement. Basic knowledge on CPU, DSP, GPU will be a plus. Experience in using collaboration tools such as GIT, SVN and JIRA. Knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing process. Wafer fabrication fundamentals are a plus. Knowledge and hands on experience with statistical analysis software package and techniques, quality and reliability testing. Strong software skills (Java, C/C++, Visual Basic, Perl, Python etc.) for programming and debugging test codes. Strong verbal and written communications skills. Able to organize effectively and document work thoroughly while working with local and remote teams. Experience with presenting product and test data driven decisions to management to drive actions. Physical Requirements • Frequently transports between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile. • Frequently transports and installs equipment up to 5 lbs. • Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting). • Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day. • Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. Minimum Qualifications Education: Bachelors - Computer Science, Bachelors - Engineering, Bachelors - Information Systems Work Experiences: Certifications: Skills: Preferred Qualifications Education: Work Experiences: 1+ years experience with circuit design (e.g., digital, analog, RF). ,1+ years experience utilizing schematic capture and circuit simulation software. ,1+ years experience with hardware design and measurement instruments such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, RF tools, etc. Certifications: Skills: Computer Science, DSP Architectures, Electrical Engineering, Optical Systems, Packaging Systems Applicants: If you need an accommodation, during the application/hiring process, you may request an accommodation by sending email to accommodationsupport To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies : Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Qualcomm. Qualcomm does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Qualcomm employees or any other company location. Qualcomm is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications. If you would like more information about this role, please contact Qualcomm Careers.

Job_Title: Principal Industrial Designer - Experience Design Group
Job_Descriptions: Experience Design Group (EDG) Overview Live and breathe Design? Are finding key concepts hidden deep in world requirements second nature? Want to create elegant Design solutions to complex problems that change the status quo? Sound intriguing? Feel compelled to just design-things-right in your everyday life, just for the sake of it? Then read on. We’re looking for members to join EDG and help create industry changing designs for Dell and the future. You need to be an expert in all things visually digital, with a major strength & focus in solving design problems through simple to understand visual explanations, and the desire & talent to produce highest quality design at every opportunity. Help craft a simple, beautiful, brand-defining experiences - always having an eye to how things could & should be… Showcase your creative talents built over your years of work experience and make us forget what it was like before you joined the team. Role Responsibilities The Principal Industrial Designer responsibilities are to define a cohesive design strategy for compute peripheral solutions that operate Commercial, Consumer and Gaming. This individual will drive user experience excellence and innovation ecosystem solutions. As a key member of a cross functional team, the Principal Designer will be required to engage customers and account executives as well client technologists to determine pain points and develop industry leading solutions. The team member will also be responsible for flawless execution of design intent leading to successful product launch and market adoption. Requirements - Undergraduate Industrial Design degree and 12+ years of relevant experience - Expert skillset in 3D CAD modeling (Cero preferred) - Expert 3D visualization skills with both sketching and digital tools (Keyshot a plus) - Can process and integrate research studies, reports, trends, data, and information into plans, deliverables, and recommendations. - Requires strong proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (primarily Photoshop, Illustrator and Aftereffects). - Strong knowledge of materials and processes as well as DFMA. - Able to follow and apply existing Design Language Guidelines. Listen. Learn. Deliver. That’s what we’re about. Dell empowers countries, communities, customers and people everywhere to use technology to realize their dreams. Customers trust us to deliver technology solutions that help them do and achieve more, whether they’re at home, work, school or anywhere in their world. Learn more about our story, purpose and people behind our customer-centric approach. Why work with us? - Life at Dell means collaborating with dedicated professionals with a passion for technology. - When we see something that could be improved, we get to work inventing the solution. - Our people demonstrate our winning culture through positive and meaningful relationships. - We invest in our people and offer a series of programs that enables them to pursue a career that fulfills their potential. - Our team members’ health and wellness is our priority as well as rewarding them for their hard work. Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.  Learn more about Diversity and Inclusion at Dell here.

Our mission is to break down the barriers of today to release the potential of tomorrow. Join us today and release yours. There are two things that we want to share with anyone considering joining us. Firstly, we’ve got big ambitions for our colleagues and the future of the organisation. These include our vision that inclusion and accessibility drive every conversation we have and every decision we make. We want our workforce to fully represent the communities and customers we serve, because a diverse business is a better business. We value every colleague, their diversity and the contribution that they make. When we say you’re welcome at BT, we really mean it. Secondly, the one thing the pandemic has taught us is that a lot of current and future colleagues, where and when possible, want to embrace hybrid working. Therefore, we are introducing smart working at BT. Smart working means having the flexibility to choose, as a team, how and where you work depending on your team’s deliverables and needs; when you are at your shared core location to connect with others and when not. It may not be for every role, and, as part of the recruitment process, you’ll have the chance to discuss smart working and how it might work for the job you are applying for. About this role This role requires CAT1 clearance from Singapore Government. The role holder might be asked to be the team lead with overall responsible for the deployment and support of IT infrastructure, systems and application software and data security to external customers. As the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for software developer, he/she provides complex technical support, resolving escalated technical support issues including proposals to ensure systems availability to the customer. The role includes problem diagnosis and resolution, and activities will comprise requirements analysis, testing, integrating, and managing components and models, including engaging product principals to ensure problem is resolved in timely manner. The role holder has an appreciation of maintaining the client relationship and satisfaction. You'll have the following responsibilities Work with minimal supervision to evaluate, co-ordinate, test and install software/hardware provided by suppliers with appropriate controls and standards e.g. Open Java, Oracle Java, C++, C#, and .NET programming. Lead a team to test & install software maintenance upgrades provided by suppliers. To provide problem diagnosis and resolution liaising (level 3 support) with technical manager, peers, suppliers, and customer/developer groups where appropriate; could be asked to provide full 24-hour on call emergency support. To maintain the operational procedures as approved by technical team leader. To lead and support recovery activities following failure including disaster recovery. To provide expert advice & guidance to other groups on technical and operational issues. To provide expert advice and expertise to support product evaluations with other groups/customers. To maintain all appropriate documentation is as accordance to ISO9001 standard. To enforce that all data security is in place in accordance with Singapore Government Security requirement. You'll have the following skills & experience Candidate must at least possess a Diploma in Computer Science or IT related studies. Those majoring in IT Security are an added advantage. A security related certification, such as CISSP, is highly desirable. Knowledge of programming technologies (Java,Java Script, C#, .NET, Visual Basic). Candidate should possess good communication skills and a positive working attitude. At least 5 years' experience in the IT with 3 years’ experience in security technologies, directory technologies and standards. Can work co-operatively with others to achieve team goals and can build stable, and useful working relationships. About BT BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here. We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential. So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT How to Apply It's easy to apply online; you just need a copy of your up-to-date CV and to follow the step-by step process. Don't worry if you need to make changes - you'll have the opportunity to review and edit your work on the final page. We look forward to receiving your application!

Seeking self-motivated, highly experienced, and dedicated team players who are passionate about building digital infrastructure. The Cloud Infrastructure Engineer will be working with an infrastructure modernization team to build and operate OCBC’s multi-Cloud across on premise and hybrid cloud infrastructure, leveraging new technology stacks to support modern application and AI driven IT operations. Responsibilities Drive Group Tech Infra Cloud Service transformation towards "Invisible Infrastructure" which provide Seamless, Scalable, Elastic infra services to support business growth. Plan, design, build and manage IT and Cloud infrastructure systems using all the latest innovation (private, public and hybrid cloud, virtualization, containers). Enable better efficiency on infra resource utilisation by adopting cloud charging model. Collaborate and work with the various stakeholder to develop technical solutions, plans and configuration for new technology infrastructure stacks. Qualifications Requirements Possesses at least a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent Solid experience on large scale infrastructure private and public cloud design, build, operate and migration projects. Minimum 5 years hands-on-experience on designing and building both on premise and hybrid cloud infrastructure, AIOps, Infrastructure as Code, DevOps toolset. This include governance and security control for multi-cloud. At least 5 years of working experience in managing cloud technology such as VMWare Cloud Foundation, Microfocus Cloud Management Platform, AWS, Azure, GCP, Terraform, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Openshift, Kafka, REDIS, etc Demonstrate strong knowledge in technology infrastructure domain such as virtual server technologies, networking, internet protocols, scripting & monitoring tools. Possess good technical knowledge in implementing, troubleshoot, performance tuning of hardware, operating system and system services. Possessing VCDX-CMA, AWS Architect Professional, Azure Solution Architect Expert and or Google’s Professional Cloud Architect certification will be an advantage. Strong analytical skill, creative and thinking out of the box in problem solving Excellent command of written and spoken English. A good team player and able to work effectively at all levels of an organization with the ability to influence others to move towards consensus. Proven ability to operate under pressure and meet challenging deadlines with minimum supervision

Job_Title: SVP / VP, Experimentation Lead, Transformation Group
Job_Descriptions: SVP / VP, Experimentation Lead, Transformation Group Business Function: Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the "World's Best Digital Bank" (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play. We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! About this role: The Transformation Group's Experience Strategy team is looking for an experienced marketer to establish our Experimentation Centre of Excellence, this is a key tenet of our transformation agenda to build a start-up culture characterised by experimentation, innovation, and agile. Responsibilities: Provide thought leadership to guide the bank towards experimentation best practices, Drive complex transformation initiatives to embed experimentation as the methodology to uncover growth opportunities, create delightful experiences, and improve productivity, Provide consultation to business teams in their experiment design, results analysis, and experiment ideation, Collaborate with business counterparts to integrate experimentation into the different stages of product development e.g. business case, budgets, MVP, release planning, customer feedback, and continuous improvements, Collaborate with technology counterparts in developing a product roadmap that enables a variety of experiment use cases across channels, reduces employee toil in experiment setup, and upholds scientific rigor, Design and manage programs to maximize adoption of experimentation capabilities by running broad base awareness programs and developing a community of practitioners, Establish governance frameworks to drive the experimentation agenda including capability development, adoption of capabilities, culture building, and KPI management. Requirements: Leadership position in customer experience, digital marketing, or growth management with hands on experience running A/B testing, funnel optimization, CRM, performance marketing, SEO, or web/app design at scale, Significant experience managing senior sponsors and working team squads in a multiple-stakeholder environment, Ability to manage complex and competing priorities, conflict management and resolution skills are required, Able to drive an agenda and influence stakeholders outside of formal reporting lines is a must, A self-starter and collaborator that flourishes in a fast-paced, ever-changing, and deadline-driven environment, Structured analytical abilities, effective communication, and presentation skills, Experience working in Financial services / Fintech is a plus. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Your field of responsibility As a part of role, your responsibility includes: •          Review, control and monitor key business and operational activities, and associated risks of PB APAC on a regional basis •          Support in the coordination of business Risk and Control Self-Assessment (RCSA) exercise across the PB APAC locations - planning meetings, status-tracking and analysis/consistency checks across the region; close interaction with partners in first and second lines of defence •          Prepare, drive and consolidate regional risk reporting and associated analysis commentary. Where appropriate, review and recommend appropriate risk indicators and/or triggers •          Support in the management and oversight of PB APAC Top risks, and the relevant mitigating actions/ remediation measures to bring risk back within appetite •          Support in open issues and actions (Regulatory/ Audit/ Second Line of Defence/ Self-Identified) management, and driving the Audit and Regulatory Governance Committee (ARGC) – status-tracking, and conduct quality assurance over regulatory and audit points as necessary to ensure ARGC efficiency •          Support in handling the Supervisory Location Governance (SLA) framework •          Manage key partners and local / regional management relationships as well as serve as an advisor to local and regional management in all areas of operational risk. •          Pro-actively identify and assess key operational and business risks across the PB APAC and where relevant, recommend innovative solutions to manage, mitigate and monitor these identified key risks •          Represent the regional business risk management on risk issues with regional management or any risk policy committee as well as taking care of advisory and review of regional internal control issues as appropriate •          Ad hoc / special projects and implementation of all business risk related tasks / projects. Your future colleagues We are a diverse team of “can-do” people on a mission to help business grow in a rapidly changing risk environment. We don't just build risk frameworks, but we enable business to achieve their business objectives within the risk appetite of the bank. The PB APAC FLDS team primarily crafts and manages risk frameworks, a key pillar in the PB APAC COO organization. The Bank strives to hire persons with the right skills when staffing the FLDS function, which is crucial in supporting the growth of the business in the rapidly changing risk environment Remote Working? N/A - pending TWWW agreement Your skills and experience At least 4 years of relevant working experience in a risk/ control/ assurance related role in the Financial Industry, preferably in Private Banking or Wealth Management. Some working knowledge of regulations in the APAC region is expected Good knowledge of APAC private banking risks environment and relevant controls would be an advantage Outstanding ability to communicate effectively through presentation and individual discussions with all levels, including attitude to build and maintain positive working relationships with all management and personnel Independent judgment with strong analytical and risk assessment skills Ability to grasp risk / control concepts quickly Excellent power-point and excel skills in analyzing data and preparing reports

Job Description: Your background • Diploma or Degree qualification • Prior and relevant working experience and knowledge of the relevant financial products • Able to work on Singapore public holidays, and potential morning shift duties • Detailed oriented, a team player and  able to perform under pressure in a fast-pace environment • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to communicate professionally in a clear, concise manner to internal and external clients at all levels Language Skills: • Good command of spoken and written English Essential Experience / Technical Knowledge: • MS Excel, Word and PC skills Other qualifications ∙ Strives to bring new thoughts and ideas to teams in order to drive innovation and unique solutions ∙ Excels in working among diverse viewpoints to determine the best path forward ∙ Experience in connecting with a diverse set of clients to understand future business needs – is a continuous learner ∙ Commitment to challenging the status quo and promoting positive change. ∙ Participate in and drive collaborative efforts to advance tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve an evolving client base ∙ Believes in value of diversity so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world What you can expect The Fixed Income, Currency and Commodities (FICC) & Derivative Core Operations (FDCO) team perform end to end trade control, confirmation and settlements processes across FICC businesses and provides utility OTC derivative confirmation and settlement services for non FICC businesses. Within FDCO, the teams provide multiple services such as FICC trade control, Foreign Exchange (FX) electronic matching and settlement, Over the Counter (OTC) derivative confirmation and settlement, and commodities operations. Main Responsibilities for this role: Support the GFX trading business in Asia for GFX products and being a team leader. What you will do Day to day responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: ▪ Verification function to ensure all trades are booked correctly, liaising with the front office or clients for any discrepancies in a timely manner ▪ Confirmation function to ensure that discrepancies and exceptions are investigated and resolved promptly ▪ Settlements functions to ensure all payments are made correctly within the payment cut off time, resolving and investigating any issues that may arise in relation to any settlements ▪ Client services function, establishing excellent working relationship and providing quality service and issue resolutions to both internal business partners and external global counterparties ▪ Participation in the team’s related projects and process improvement initiatives ▪ Managing a team About Bank of America Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading. Connecting Asia Pacific to the world Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President, GCIB Credit, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description: About Bank of America Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading. Connecting Asia Pacific to the world Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies. Responsibilities Primary responsibility is to actively manage the credit aspects for the portfolio of borrowers which comprise subsidiaries of multinational companies domiciled in Southeast Asia and Australia: Lead and manage the acceptance process for these incoming credit relationships. Spreading of financial statements. Preparation of credit proposals and financial analysis of borrowers and obtain local risk approval. Preparation, review & negotiation of credit documents and loan agreements. Perform ongoing portfolio monitoring and identify, escalate & manage emerging risks in the portfolio. Ensure portfolio is compliant with internal policy and procedures as well as regulatory requirements. Prepare and participate in internal/external/regulatory audits, reportings, surveys and examinations. Participate in projects/initiatives to streamline and improve processes. Competencies Has a good command of written and spoken English. Ability to speak a Southeast Asia native language – Malay, Thai or Filipino is preferred but not a must. Knowledge of banking products across Loan, Trade Finance, Transactional Services & Treasury. Has a good understanding of standard terms and conditions in credit documentation. Able to interpret and analyze financial statements. Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Has an analytical mind and takes a proactive attitude towards problem solving. Excellent time management skills and the ability to work effectively under pressure. Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance with 3-4 years’ or more experience in banking and finance or related field. Bank of America is an equal opportunities employer.
